data.text: @covid_clarity Interesting if ones a sheeple I suppose. Expected by people who see right through all their BS!  It’s not about our health, never has been for them. They’ve proven this time and time again. But I’m thinking you know this too :)
@covid_clarity The CDC follows the same guidelines as that show "Whose Line is it Anyway". Everything is made up and the points don't matter.
@covid_clarity I know at least here in Oregon most deaths being reported now are from mid-January. With plummeting hospitalizations it would seem that current deaths would be way down.

@covid_clarity Cases, hospitalizations and deaths were lower last February than they have been this year. We sure have to feel fortunate that we had the vaccines. It would have been much worse.
https://t.co/Us3k9tJsFI
@covid_clarity Interference with the election polls. Numbers are down time to get rid of restrictions. People will look back in this time in History and Laugh, hysterically.
@PaulRoundy1 True. More so, I think Omicron changed the calculus... so many were infected and now have some level of immunity, regardless of vaccination.
@GuyGadboisGuyG1 @covid_clarity I’d like to have more rational policies strictly aimed at reducing spread at low points to stop new surges, but that may not be possible given how Americans behave.

@GuyGadboisGuyG1 @covid_clarity It’s the study of human behavior. They know Americans won’t adhere to mitigation advice constantly for years at a time. So they adjust recommendations that allow for temporary measure when things are at their worst. Cases are way, way down from the omicron peak.
